title: Jr AI Developer/ Engineer
description:
We are seeking a talented and innovative AI Developer who can join our team and lead the development of an AI-powered graphics design tool. In this role, you will be responsible for creating an intuitive, cutting-edge design tool that leverages artificial intelligence to empower designers, artists, and creative professionals to produce stunning visual content more efficiently.  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Has 1-3 yrs. experience of Python Programming/ Data Science / Machine Learning experience
* AI Integration: Collaborate with the development team to integrate AI and machine learning algorithms into a graphics design tool. Implement AI features that can enhance design processes, automate tasks, and generate creative suggestions.
* AI Model Training: Develop and fine-tune AI models for tasks such as image recognition, style transfer, and automated design suggestions, based on user requirements.
* Algorithm Implementation: Implement computer vision and deep learning algorithms to support image manipulation, filtering, and transformation, as well as other creative design features.
* Performance Optimization: Optimize the tool's performance to ensure fast and efficient operations, even with large files and complex designs.
* User Feedback Integration: Gather user feedback and insights to continuously improve the AI graphics design tool and its functionality.
* Documentation: Create clear and comprehensive documentation for users and developers, including guides and tutorials on using AI features.

title: Senior Director Decision Science
description:
As an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.


**I. Job Summary**

  


The Senior Director of ENP Decision Science will define and deliver the advanced analytics strategy and data science vision within the Enterprise Network Planning function.



Responsible for developing, implementing, and refining an optimization model for enterprise network volume forecasting and planning. For our disposal network this includes modeling disposal volumes flows, both internal and 3rd party, and enabling a model to forecast future capacity constraints and needs. The model would need the capability to use data science to ingest "what if" scenarios to allow forecasting of price/volume sensitivity including "next best alternative" analysis. The model would allow for cost tradeoff analysis for future disposal infrastructure and disposal flow changes to include landfill closures/openings, acquisition modeling, transfer stations closures/openings, and transfer barge and rail capabilities/needs and impacts.



For our hauling operations this model would be used to rationalize current locations, inform where new locations should be built to accommodate growth goals, and enable acquisition facility and cost modeling. This role leads the development, maintenance, and execution of scenarios around the model.


**II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

  

* Design and develop solutions which leverage advanced analytics, predictive analytics and machine learning integrated into WM’s network planning.
* Leverage understanding of the business to define data and technology needs to create modeling tools to enable strategic forecasting and decision making for enterprise facilities including landfill, hauling, transfer stations, transfer network
* Review existing systems in relation to future needs and benefits and recommend improvements to meet WM’s needs
* Manage data science projects involving timelines, vendor relationships, and budgets to ensure projects are delivered with the highest quality and within specified timeframes
* Identify opportunities for innovation to ensure WM’s leadership position within the industry landscape


**III.** **Qualifications**



The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.



A. Education and Experience


* Education: Bachelor’s Degree (accredited) in Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering, Data Sciences, or similar area of study; or High School Diploma or GED (accredited) and four years of relevant experience required. Master's degree (accredited) in Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering, Data Sciences, or similar area of study preferred.
* Experience: 10+ years of previous experience with demonstrated leadership in advanced analytics and data science required.


B. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required


* Leadership experience with progressively more responsibility within the Data Science and Advanced Analytics landscape
* Experience in envisioning a future state, defining the current state, and drive technology creation to close the gap between the status quo and needed change
* Demonstrated people management and team leadership skills
* Ability to work with people from all levels and across the organization
* Demonstrated project management skills and ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently
* Experience with multiple vendors in any of the following areas including; R, Python, SAS, SQL, SageMaker, Spark, Lambda, Cplex, ArcGIS, Snowflake, Cassandra, AWS S3


**IV. Work Environment**  

Office: This job primarily operates in a professional office environment and routinely requires the use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, copy machines, etc.


**Benefits**  

At WM, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company match on 401K, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.



If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click "Apply".

title: Principal Architect: Data Applications
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

Step into the role of a Principal Architect at JPMorgan Chase and become a driving force behind the development and adoption of cutting-edge, cloud-based technologies.


As a **Principal Architect** at **JPMorgan Chase** within the Chief Technology Office as part of Global Technology operates firmwide, liaising with different lines of business to deliver innovative data management products, services and value add solutions. Our vision is to continuously evolve using best-in-class tools and technologies in managing vast amounts of data to enable AI/ML initiatives throughout the firm and enhance our ability to provide market leading capabilities.


Our philosophy is to function in a product operating model to iteratively discover, design, develop and deliver great outcomes to our customers quickly and securely. You provide expertise to enhance and develop architecture platforms based on modern cloud-based technologies, as well as support the adoption of strategic global solutions. Leverage your advanced architecture capabilities and collaborate with colleagues across the organization to drive best-in-class outcomes.

**Job responsibilities**

* Advises cross-functional teams on technology selection to achieve target state architecture and decisions on improvements to current technologies
* Develops multi-year roadmaps aligned with business and architecture strategy and priorities
* Creates complex and scalable coding frameworks using appropriate software design
* Develops secure and high-quality production code, and reviews and debugs code written by others
* Focus on integrated “user experience” to enforce system thinking approach as part of the platform delivery
* Organize and manage solutions libraries that focus on end-to-end data lifecycle experience form data origination, data management, data governance, and data consumption
* Enable co-design and co-development model to accelerate critical business priorities while maintaining core design principles of the platformnd quality of output across teams and functions
* Champions the firm’s culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and respect

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 7+ years applied experience with strong development background in core Java or Python
* Hands-on practical experience delivering system design, application development, testing, and operational stability
* Deep knowledge in one or more software, applications, and architecture
* Advanced knowledge of software architecture, application development, and technical processes with considerable in-depth knowledge in one or more technical disciplines (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)
* Experience applying expertise and new methods to determine solutions for complex architecture problems in one or more technical disciplines
* Expert level experience with AWS or other Public Cloud providers
* Expert level with Databricks, Snowflake, Starburst, Trino, Immuta, Databases, and Streaming processing technologies like Kafka, Flink, Kinesis
* Hands on experience in working on BI and AI/ML solutions with business stakeholders and data scientists


**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills*** Ability to present and effectively communicate to Senior Leaders and Executives
* Up to date knowledge in industry-wide technology trends and best practices in Data & AI/ML space
* Influencer with a proven record of successfully driving change and transforming across organizational boundaries
* Understanding of the business
* Practical cloud native experience

**ABOUT US**  


JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, we offer discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of firm performance and individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.


We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.


JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Veterans

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  

  

Our professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we’re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.

title: CORPORATE SENIOR DATA ARCHITECT
description:
**CORPORATE SENIOR DATA ARCHITECT**  

  

Location:
  

Newport News, Virginia, United States  

  

Date: Apr 12, 2024  

  

Req ID: 37266
  

Team: N352 CYBERSECURITY & INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
  

Entity: HII Corporate Office  

  

US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes
  

  

Full-Time
  

Shift: 1st
  

Relocation: Relocation assistance will be available
  

Virtual/Telework Opportunity: Yes - Occasional or hybrid telework available
  

  

Travel Requirement: Yes, 10%-25% of the time
  

  

**Meet HII's Corporate Team**  

HII's corporate team is responsible for providing strategic direction across technological and business disciplines, including accounting, finance, human resources, sales, operations, business development, legal, sustainability, communications, information technology, security, and more. In service of our employees, leaders, customers, and shareholders, we have the privilege of supporting thousands of colleagues across the entire business. Find the role that's right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you.  

  

**The Role**  

  

As a Senior Data Architect with HII, you will be expected to possess a comprehensive skill set, combining technical expertise, strategic thinking, and a deep understanding of both cybersecurity and broader IT domains. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in all IT domains, including but not limited to network architecture, system design, cloud computing, data management, application development, and cybersecurity practices.
  

  

In this role, you will be directly responsible for driving the architecture of our data systems and processes - this involves designing, implementing and maintaining the technical systems that store, process and analyze data. Your primary focus will be on designing and managing enterprise data management frameworks, interpreting business requirements into technical requirements, and collaborating with various stakeholders to optimize data utilization to ensure that our data infrastructure is robust, scalable, and adheres to industry best practices. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs to architect and design data solutions that drive decision-making and innovation.
  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
  

* Work across cybersecurity and IT domains to align technology capabilities with business objectives.
* Create and implement scalable, resilient and secure architectures for systems, networks, applications, and databases.
* Develop and maintain data architecture strategies to support the organization's objectives, emphasizing data engineering, intelligence, security, and governance.
* Design, implement, and optimize data models and databases for efficient storage and retrieval of information.
* Oversee the integration of various data sources, ensuring data consistency, quality, and reliability.
* Establish and enforce data security protocols, including encryption, access controls, and compliance with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, etc.).
* Lead initiatives for data governance, defining policies, standards, and procedures for data management and usage.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Remote work option considered
  

  

  

**Must Have**  

  

Bachelor's Degree and 14 years of relevant exempt experience; Master's Degree and 12 years of relevant professional experience; Ph.D. and 9 years of experience.
  

  

A relevant professional certification can be substituted for the Bachelor's degree.  

  

**Nice to Have**  

* Proven experience in a senior role focusing on IT systems, data architecture, engineering, intelligence, security, and governance.
* Strong expertise in database design, data modeling, and ETL processes.
* Deep understanding of data categorization and meta data deployment best practices.
* In-depth knowledge of data security practices and compliance requirements.
* Experience with industry-leading data management tools and technologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work across various teams and departments.
* Ability to obtain clearance
* Relevant certifications in data architecture or security
* Experience in Department of Defense is a plus.
* Familiarity with cloud-based data solutions (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
Experience in one or more areas across Data Analytics domain including data storage (Data Lake & Data Warehouse), data integration, business intelligence.  
* 

  

  

**Why HII**  

We build the world's most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. HII's diverse workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals.  

  

Recognized as one of America's top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people's safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you'll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career.  

  

Working at HII is more than a job - it's an opportunity to build a future. We offer comprehensive benefits including: medical, prescription drug, dental and vision plan choices, on-site health centers, tele-medicine, wellness resources, employee assistance programs, savings plan options (401K), financial education and planning tools, life insurance, tuition reimbursement, employee discounts, early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships, and more. Some benefits may vary depending on your specific division or work location.  

  

**Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive.**  

  

Today's challenges are bigger than ever, and the nation needs the best of us. It's why we're focused on hiring, developing and nurturing our diversity. We believe that diversity among our workforce strengthens the organization, stimulates creativity, promotes the exchange of ideas and enriches the work lives of all our employees.  

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.  

  

**Do You Need Assistance?**  

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to buildyourcareer@hii-co.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address.  

  

Additionally, you may also call **1-844-849-8463** for assistance.

title: Data Science Facilitator
description:
### **Job Summary:**


The WID is seeking an individual to advance the research activities of faculty members, students, and staff in a broad range of scholarly disciplines that would benefit from data science methods.



Facilitators will perform training and community engagement in data science across the UW-Madison campus. More specifically, the Facilitator will consult with researchers on campus to recommend appropriate solutions to data science problems impeding their research, where solution pathways for the researcher will consider resources on campus and beyond, including existing learning resources, data management services, computing resources, consultations and collaboration with data science and computational methods experts, identification and pursuit of funding opportunities, and/or pathways for leveraging effort from campus data science teams and associated faculty. The Facilitator will also design workshops and teach existing trainings to help researchers learn data analysis tools and automation that will make their research more scalable and reproducible.



The Facilitator will also collaborate closely with research groups on short term projects; specifically developing workflows, reviewing code, helping with project management, teaching coding and computation skills, and providing other guidance that supports the researcher's work. The successful applicant will gain a wide range of skills at this job and will have the opportunity to work with experts in a range of research areas and data-centric technologies.


### **Responsibilities:**


Works with researchers to provide advice and training on data preparation and data science analysis.
* 10% Advises researchers on how to organize and prepare data sets for analysis including cleaning/quality assurance, transformations, restructuring, and integration of multiple data sources
* 10% Advises researchers on how to use data science techniques to find data patterns and answer research questions, such as data visualization, statistical analysis, machine learning, and data mining
* 10% Advises researchers on how to compose and assemble reproducible workflows and patterns to researchers and/or administrators
* 15% Formulates reproducible research approaches based on interactions with research teams and contributes to the establishment of reproducible and well-documented research protocols through training and communication activities
* 35% Designs, develops, and implements training on data science and data science tools
* 20% Collaborates directly with research teams on short term projects or supports researchers through engagement in communities of practice and or other consulting efforts

### **Institutional Statement on Diversity:**


Diversity is a source of strength, creativity, and innovation for UW-Madison. We value the contributions of each person and respect the profound ways their identity, culture, background, experience, status, abilities, and opinion enrich the university community. We commit ourselves to the pursuit of excellence in teaching, research, outreach, and diversity as inextricably linked goals.  

  

The University of Wisconsin-Madison fulfills its public mission by creating a welcoming and inclusive community for people from every background - people who as students, faculty, and staff serve Wisconsin and the world.

  

### **Education:**


Required  

Bachelor's Degree  

Candidates with a bachelor's degree and professional experience will be considered.  

  

Preferred  

Master's Degree  

A Master's degree (MS or MA) or higher in a research focused area of study is preferred.


### **Qualifications:**


Required:  

* At least two years of experience in a data-and/or compute-intensive area is required. Academic experience does qualify.
* Strong oral and written communication skills, with attention to interpersonal relationships, and professionalism
* Ability to work independently and in a team setting to establish and maintain effective working relationships
* Demonstrate strong abilities in critical analysis and creative problem solving
* Possess a demonstrated interest and prior experience in helping others to elevate their work
* Possess basic skills with tools for data curation, analysis, and/or visualization, including scripting languages, databases, visualization software and/or platforms, use of large-scale computing systems, etc.

  

Preferred:
  

* Highly Preferred: Experience applying data science methods relevant to the social sciences or digital humanities, such as text analysis with natural language processing, network analysis, or geospatial data analysis and visualization
* Prior work as a data scientist (or similar position), whether in industry or academic research contexts
* An appreciation for a range of data-intensive research
* Experience in at least one research domain such as: humanities, social sciences, life sciences, physical sciences, or engineering
* Experience and demonstrated interest in education, outreach, mentoring, consulting, and community-building


-Contribution to a Software, Data, or Library Carpentry workshop or other data- or computation-focused training effort(s)
### **Work Type:**


Full or Part Time: 50% - 100%  

  

This position may require some work to be performed in-person, onsite, at a designated campus work location. Some work may be performed remotely, at an offsite, non-campus work location.


### **Appointment Type, Duration:**


Ongoing/Renewable


### **Salary:**


**Minimum** $60,000 ANNUAL (12 months)
  

Depending on Qualifications

  

Hiring rate will be based on the full-time equivalent rate starting at 60k and offers will be commensurate with education, skills, and experience. Employees in this position can expect to receive benefits such as generous vacation, holidays, and paid time off; competitive insurances and savings accounts; retirement benefits (https://www.wisconsin.edu/ohrwd/benefits/download/fasl.pdf).


### **How to Apply:**


To be considered, applications must be submitted online. Please click on the "Apply Now" button to start the application process. You will be required to upload a cover letter and CV.
  

  

Cover letters will be used as a writing sample and to determine the best qualified applicants. Your cover letter should address your qualifications as they pertain to this position and your education and/or experience as applicable.


### **Contact:**


Calvin Phomsena  

phomsena@wisc.edu  

608-316-4496  

Relay Access (WTRS): 7-1-1. See RELAY\_SERVICE for further information.


### **Official Title:**


Data Science Facilitator I(RE062)


### **Department(s):**


A34-OVCR/WID/WI INST DISC


### **Employment Class:**


Academic Staff-Renewable


### **Job Number:**


296415-AS

  

### **The University of Wisconsin-Madison is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, including but not limited to, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, pregnancy, disability, or status as a protected veteran and other bases as defined by federal regulations and UW System policies. We promote excellence through diversity and encourage all qualified individuals to apply.  

  

Employment will require a criminal background check. It will also require you and your references to answer questions regarding sexual violence and sexual harassment.  

  

The University of Wisconsin System will not reveal the identities of applicants who request confidentiality in writing, except that the identity of the successful candidate will be released. See Wis. Stat. sec. 19.36(7).  

  

The Annual Security and Fire Safety Report contains current campus safety and disciplinary policies, crime statistics for the previous 3 calendar years, and on-campus student housing fire safety policies and fire statistics for the previous 3 calendar years. UW-Madison will provide a paper copy upon request; please contact the University of Wisconsin Police Department.

title: Machine Learning Engineering Lead
description:
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.
We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!
Job Description
Position Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineering Lead to join our team. You will have a experience delivering projects and will advance our mission to build, deploy, and sustain machine learning models that optimize process performance indicators and trends.
You will plan, manager, and control the activities of a team that provides technology-based data reporting tools and management for business segments or the company at large. You'll bring expertise or identify subject matter experts to support multi-functional efforts to identify, interpret and produce recommendations based on company reporting and data needs. You will generate recommendations for business groups by providing technical reports that identify and address business issues and opportunities. You will ensure that guardrails and procedures align with corporate strategic vision. You will also select, develop, and evaluate personnel ensuring efficient operation of the function in an agile process.
You will report to the Director, MLE and Data Science.
Essential Functions:* Lead the execution of technical roadmaps and data pipelines for digital products featuring AI/ML algorithms, including low coding, data, and models at scale
* Lead a team of MLEs and provide guidance and mentorship to ensure successful project delivery
* Collaborate with teams to identify opportunities for implementing machine learning solutions to improve business processes
* Develop and implement ML-based solutions and components for detecting anomalous conditions and singularities in monitored processes and operations
* Stay up to date with the latest advancements in machine learning and data science to ensure our solutions are cutting-edge and effective.
* Understand, explore, and deliver relevant data analyses to inform data inclusion, exclusion, and sub-setting criteria and feature and model selection for DH&I solutions.
* Collaborate with data scientists to analyze and select appropriate data models and algorithms across multiple operations/departments using diverse data.
* Coordinate with data engineering teams to extract and create data features from large datasets for input into models.
* Coordinate work with data scientists to define model validation strategies, train, and tune models, and analyze and resolve errors in models.
* Lead model deployment to production.
* Define and develop model monitoring and maintenance processes including metrics to assess accuracy, drift, etc.
* Lead and develop standards, processes, and best practices for the team across the data science-based solution implementation lifecycle.


The Essentials - You Will Have:* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent years of relevant work experience
* Ability to travel up to 20% as needed


The Preferred - You Might Also Have:* Typically requires 5+ years of relevant leadership experience.
* Master's or higher in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Automation, Informatics, Sustainability, Math, Statistics, or similar field.
* Experience leading teams or projects in ML and Data Sciencie areas.
* Prior experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Engineer, Software Engineer, or similar role.
* Understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture.
* Experience writing code in Python (opensource contributions or Kaggle kernels).
* Familiarity with Linux operating system.
* Experience working with teams in an Agile setting.
* Experience deploying a machine learning model to production on Azure, Google, Amazon Web Services (AWS) or similar cloud technology service suite.
* Expeirence with Generative AI, LLMs, Prompt Engineering.
* Hands-on experience using Databricks or Apache Spark (i.e., PySpark, SparkR, or Scala) and understanding best practices.
* Hands-on experience with multiple programming languages – Python, SQL, Scala, R, Golang, C#, JavaScript, C/C++ or similar.
* Proficiency in using and extending ML frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
* Experience with Vertex AI or AWS SageMaker stack.
* Publications or conference presentations on topics in the machine learning arena.


What We Offer:* Health Insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision
* 401k
* Paid Time off
* Parental and Caregiver Leave
* Flexible Work Schedule where you will work with your manager to enjoy a work schedule that fit with your personal life.
* To learn more about our benefits package, please visit at www.raquickfind.com.


The Base Salary Compensation range for this role is $128,720 - 193,080 with an annual target bonus of 8% of base salary. Our company benefits for the US can be found here. Actual pay will be based on factors such as skills, knowledge, education, and experience.
This position is part of a job family. Experience will be the determining factor for position level and compensation.
#LI-MG4
#LI-Remote
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans.
If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (844) 404-7247.

04/22/2024

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Microsoft Payments is at the forefront of revolutionizing the payment industry, aiming to bring forth innovative solutions and experiences for customers across Microsoft's ecosystem of products, including Xbox, Office, Ads and Azure. As part of the Commerce and Ecosystems (C&E) organization, we are dedicated to shaping the future of fintech through cutting-edge machine learning modeling and Artifical Intelligence-driven solutions, driving innovation in payment experiences and platform capabilities.  

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join our team at Microsoft Payments.You will be responsible for developing and implementing cutting-edge algorithms, such as reinforcement learning, to enhance our payment platform's capabilities and security. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work at the intersection of data science, finance, and technology, contributing to the development of next-generation payment experiences for millions of users worldwide.  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Utilize advanced machine learning and AI techniques, such as reinforcement learning, to develop predictive models and algorithms for payment process optimization and fraud detection.
* This includes leveraging data to increase approval rates, reduce costs, and minimize chargeback amounts.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions that improve payment processes and customer experiences, ultimately enhancing overall satisfaction and loyalty.
* Lead the design and implementation of scalable data pipelines and analytical frameworks to support ongoing payment modeling efforts, ensuring robust and efficient data processing for timely insights and decision-making.
* Drive the development and deployment of innovative techniques for real-time monitoring and mitigation of payment fraud and security threats, proactively safeguarding the payment platform and maintaining trust with customers and partners.
* Mentor and guide junior data scientists in the team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation, and ensuring the development of talent capable of driving future advancements in payment analytics and security.

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required Qualifications:*** Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND 4+ years experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
	+ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND 3+ year(s) experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
	+ OR equivalent experience.

**Other Requirements:**
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:* Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

 **Preferred Qualifications:*** Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering , or related field AND 8+ years experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
	+ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND 6+ years of business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work experience
	+ OR equivalent experience.


Data Engineering IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $112,000 - $218,400 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $145,800 - $238,600 per year.  

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay

title: Principal Applied Scientist
description:
Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. We are looking for a Principal Applied Scientist who can bring deep applied science expertise and a track record of shipping at-scale, AI-enabled, intelligent user-facing experiences to drive vision and execution for Microsoft 365 AI. Microsoft believes that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission. The Microsoft Search, Assistant, and Intelligence (MSAI) group is leading this effort. We are working to change the lives and work of hundreds of millions by building deep intelligence into M365 Chat, Search, Recommendation and Knowledge powered scenarios that people use every day in Outlook, Teams, Windows, Edge, Office, SharePoint, and OneDrive.  

As a Principal Applied Scientist in MSAI, you would work in an exciting and fast-paced environment, collaborating closely with teams across the company, including Microsoft Research. You will work as part of an organization that brings together talent in the areas of large language models, recommender systems, machine learning, deep learning, graph learning, information retrieval, software engineering, and responsible AI. We value and encourage diversity in the belief that it leads to both great workplaces and great products.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Conduct applied science experiments, create and validate metrics, develop ML pipeline and modeling algorithm in the area of Large Language Models, Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval, and Machine Learning.
* Develop and deploy conversational and language understanding models at scale.
* Push the boundaries of AI platforms through innovation and partnership.
* Following and advancing best practices for Responsible AI and Privacy Preserving Machine Learning.
* Collaborate closely with Microsoft Research, Microsoft Turing, Azure, AI platform teams, and product teams to create the next generation of AI innovation in our products and services.
* Support and develop a thriving applied science culture within the MSAI organization to encourage experimentation, scientific process, and innovation.
* Embody our culture and values

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required/Minimum Qualifications:*** Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Electrical or Computer Engineering, or related field AND 6+ years related experience (e.g., statistics, predictive analytics, research)
	+ OR Master's Degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Electrical or Computer Engineering, or related field AND 4+ years related experience (e.g., statistics, predictive analytics, research)
	+ OR Doctorate in Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Electrical or Computer Engineering, or related field AND 3+ years related experience (e.g., statistics, predictive analytics, research)
	+ OR equivalent experience.

**Preferred Qualifications:*** 4+ years of design and coding experience
* 4+ years of experience of large-scale machine learning
* Dedicated C#, or Java or Python or C/C++ coding skills
* Free thinkers with ability to socialize and drive their ideas into technology are highly desired.
* Ph.D. preferred but not required
* Exposure with federated learning, eyes of learning and knowledge of NLP


Applied Sciences IC5 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $133,600 - $256,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $173,200 - $282,200 per year.  

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay

title: Director of Data Science
description:
Overview:
**Director of Data Science****Location: Tysons Corner, VA****Clearance: US Citizen**  

Integral Federal is hiring a Director of Data Science to support program evaluations, conducts opportunity technical analysis, and identifies and aligns initiatives to broader business goals and objectives.
Responsibilities:
* The Director of Data Science provides a clear direction for the data science function, aligning it with overall business goals and objectives.
* They identify opportunities to leverage data science for competitive advantage and innovation.
* They provide leadership and guidance on data science projects throughout their lifecycle, from problem definition to deployment. They offer deep technical knowledge in areas like machine learning, statistical modeling, data analysis, and big data processing.
* They communicate complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights for customers, business leaders and executives.
* They provide expertise on data science methodologies, algorithms, tools and best practices, and support proposal development and capture efforts.
* They stay current on the evolving data science landscape to identify emerging trends, technologies and best practices.
* They foster relationships with external partners, current and potential customers and across the organization.


Qualifications:
**Required:**  

* A Master’s degree in a relevant field like computer science, statistics, mathematics, or engineering.
* 3-5 years of Data Science experience
* A track record of successful project delivery, including the ability to develop IRAD concepts and pilots for customers.
* Experience leading and writing to technical solutions for RFI, Sources Sought and proposal efforts.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication and customer relationship skills and the ability to communicate complex technical solutions simply and effectively.
* Attention to detail and the ability to develop projects and prototypes.
* Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.
* The ability to obtain and maintain a clearance.

 **Preferred:**  

* Experience providing solutions adopted by Department of Defense clients.
* Experience working on projects in conjunction with or in support of the CDAO.
* Experience with AWS or Azure Analytics Services

Integral partners with federal defense, intelligence, and civilian leaders to tackle their most important challenges and deliver positive outcomes. Since our founding in 1998, we have helped clients leverage existing and emerging technologies to transform their enterprises, empower growth, drive innovation, and build sustainable success. The forward-leaning solutions we deliver are tailored to each mission with a focus on keeping our nation safe and secure.

title: Associate Analyst of Optimization & Mathematical Programming
description:
Overview:

At ITA International, we’re a tech-enabled professional services company. Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, we leverage subject matter expertise, data analytics and technology to challenge boundaries and transform possibilities.  

With a global presence and a passionate team of over 300 ITAers, we’re driven by mission success for our customers, “In The Arena.” Our expertise spans Operations, Training, Engineering, Nanotechnology, Statistics, Machine Learning and Software Engineering – enabling data and tech-enabled solutions that deliver real value.  

Join our impactful journey at ITA International. As Theodore Roosevelt said, “The credit belongs to the man who is actually in the arena.” We’re here, standing beside our customers, ready to serve and succeed.  

ITA is hiring an Associate Analyst of Optimization & Mathematical Programming to join the team to support Navy and Marine Corps analyses efforts. *Please note this opportunity is contingent upon contract award.*
Responsibilities:

This role is critical for supporting various customer-focused software development projects with a hybrid work model. The Associate Analyst will play a pivotal role in formulating optimization approaches and developing both desktop and cloud-based tools. These tools are essential for analyzing investment strategies, best practices, and logistic networks to inform decision-making processes within the context of mission priorities/goals, budget constraints, and logistic optimization. **Key Responsibilities:*** **Optimization Formulation and Implementation:**
	+ Formulate optimization approaches to support decision-making in investment strategies, logistic networks, and schedules.
	+ Implement these approaches through the development of desktop and cloud-based analytical tools.
* **Tool Identification and Assessment:**
	+ Identify the best available tools for optimization tasks, considering government data restrictions.
	+ Assess the pros and cons of different formulation designs, methodologies, solver capabilities, and the tools available, aiming for the optimal balance between accuracy and solution time.
* **Migration and Automation:**
	+ Execute tasks related to the migration and transition of optimization solvers from desktop to cloud-based platforms.
	+ Develop and automate data pre-processing and post-processing routines to streamline the optimization process.
* **Optimization Analysis:**
	+ Conduct multi-scenario optimization runs, analyzing results to identify insights, key differences between scenarios, and underlying causes.
	+ Highlight opportunities for model improvement based on scenario analysis.
* **Visualization and Reporting:**
	+ Prepare analytical tools to support the visualization of optimization input data, results, and methodologies.
	+ Perform ad-hoc analyses and develop comprehensive reports in response to client requests, ensuring clarity and actionable insights.


Qualifications:

Required qualifications:* Ability to work successfully within cross-functional teams.
* Ability to write and communicate effectively.
* Ability to be flexible and adapt quickly to the changing requirements.
* Ability to organize multiple work assignments and establish priorities.
* Bachelor's Degree in related scientific field (Engineering, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, etc.)
* Familiarity in development of optimization decision support tools in desktop environment using Open Source software
* Skilled use of MS Excel (formulas, add-ons, pivot tables) and other government MS Office tools to support collaboration, analysis, and data visualization with globally-distributed stakeholders.
* Experience using at least one visualization tool software (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, VISIO, etc).
* Experience applying research methods to support model development and strategy, including literature reviews and stakeholder interviews to identify problem statements, inform data requirements, and develop model methodology and formulation.
* Moderate proficiency with at least one optimization-specific software
* Experience applying and presenting analytic methods to inform decision making.
* Proficiency with one or more programming language (Python, R, Java, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), etc.)
* **No clearance required, but candidate must be willing and able to obtain SECRET clearance.**

  

Additional preferred qualifications:* **SECRET clearance**
* Master’s in Operations Research, Data Science/Analysis, or related applied mathematics field
* Proficiency with advanced analytic methods (statistics, simulation, optimization, machine learning).
* Proficiency with open-source optimization tools
* Demonstrated past experience using or developing capital planning models for strategic investment decisions over extended time horizon (10+ years)
* Civil engineering and/or facility planning experience
* Experience with the public sector, including government desktop programs and cloud environments (local shared drive, government SharePoint, government cloud)
* Experience with resourcing, logistics, financial management/accounting, investment planning, vehicle fleet management, and/or logistics planning
* Experience in Agile project planning and execution


Benefit and Compensation Transparency:

ITA International proudly complies with all federal and state benefit and pay transparency laws. Employees of ITA can expect a robust benefit package, including:* Medical, dental and vision plans
* Life Insurance
* Short Term Disability insurance (where applicable)
* Voluntary ancillary benefit options
* 401k retirement benefits with employer matching contributions


Application and Employment at ITA International:

ITA International is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

In compliance with the ADA Amendments Act (ADAAA), ITA International would like to ensure that your application process goes as smoothly as possible. If you would like to preview the physical requirements for this position, or if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a currently open position with ITA, please contact us by phone at 757-246-6781 or email us at HR@ita-intl.com.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“Jamison”) is currently seeking a qualified and motivated candidate for the position of Senior Data Analyst.
  
  

**Job Title:** Senior Data Analyst – Alexandria, Virginia
  
  

**DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES:**  

The position of Senior Data Analyst is responsible for developing and implementing a set of techniques or analytics applications to transform raw data into meaningful information using data-oriented programming languages and visualization software.
  
  

**REQUIRED AND DESIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:**  

* Bachelor's Degree in some related field, like Computer Science or Mathematics. This degree should have provided you with studying in statistics, programming, and databases. Additionally, you should have some experience working with data management tools, like SQL, Python, or R.
* Prefer previous Data Analyst work experience.
* Experience working with using statistical analysis software such as SAS.
* Must be skilled in analyzing and reporting data.
* Collect and organize large sets of data for analysis.
* Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
* Use statistical tools and software to process and interpret data.
* Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
* Develop and implement strategies to improve business performance based on data analysis.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and develop solutions.
* Maintain and update databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
* Conduct regular audits of data sources to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.


**JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Apply data mining, data modeling, natural language processing, and machine learning to extract and analyze information from large structured and unstructured datasets.
* Visualize, interpret, report data findings.
* Create dynamic data reports.
* Develop statistical analysis plans and data management procedures using relational database principles, protocols, and methodology.
* Integrates and analyzes data from many sources, including resolving data problems.
* Conducts complex and detailed quantitative statistical analyses, using statistical analysis software such as SAS, to evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of programs and service delivery.
* Performs quantitative statistical analyses using complex analytic methods, including multiple regression, general linear model, correlation, t-test, creating composite variables, and longitudinal analysis.
* Performs qualitative statistical analysis of large datasets of written comments to identify themes and draw validated conclusions.


HOURS OF OPERATION
  
  

TBD
  
  

**PRIMARY PLACE OF PERFORMANCE:**  

4800 Alexandria Drive
  
  

Alexandria, Virginia 22350
  
  

The Government will leverage a mixture of an in-person and telework posture in support of PWS tasks based on operational requirements.
  
  

**TRAVEL:**  

Required travel annually.
  
  

**Clearance Level Required:** Must be able to pass a Federal Background check.
  
  

**JAMISON CORPORATE OVERVIEW:**  

Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (Jamison) is a Service-Disabled, Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), certified Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) headquartered in metropolitan Atlanta, Georgia. We specialize in providing professional management, administrative, healthcare, court reporters and transcriptionist experts, and document/ record and telehealth operational support solutions to U.S. Government, State, and commercial clients. Jamison is a nationwide professional staff augmentation company, that helps commercial clients and government agencies expand their talent acquisition reach by sourcing, assessing, developing, and managing the talent that enables them to be successful.
  
  

Jamison offers a wide range of employment opportunities in the commercial and government sectors. We seek employees who share our values of service excellence, integrity, and professionalism.
  
  

Jamison affords equal employment opportunity to all individuals, regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Our employees, as well as applicants and others with whom we do business, will not be subjected to sexual, racial, religious, ethnic, or any other form of unlawful harassment and/or discrimination. In addition, Jamison adheres to the equal employment opportunity requirements of all states and localities in which it does business.
  
  

Jamison's commitment to equal opportunity is applied through every aspect of the employment relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, placement, training, compensation, promotion, transfer, termination, and all other matters of employment.
  
  

Applicants may be required to successfully complete an online assessment to determine qualifications for positions requiring specific skills.
  
  

All applications must be submitted through our application system at: https://www.jps-online.com/apply-now/

title: AI Software Specialist
description:
**AI Software Specialist**
==========================

Experience Level: Individual Contributor
Job Type: Full-Time
Location:
TX - Richardson, US
Requisition ID: 6910
Qorvo (Nasdaq: QRVO) supplies innovative semiconductor solutions that make a better world possible. We combine product and technology leadership, systems-level expertise and global manufacturing scale to quickly solve our customers' most complex technical challenges. Qorvo serves diverse high-growth segments of large global markets, including consumer electronics, smart home/IoT, automotive, EVs, battery-powered appliances, network infrastructure, healthcare and aerospace/defense. Visit www.qorvo.com to learn how our diverse and innovative team is helping connect, protect and power our planet.

  



Summary: The sales and marketing team is seeking a skilled AI software specialist to help lead the integration of AI tools and applications across sales, marketing, and applications engineering platforms. The role requires working with the central sales, applications, operations, and data science teams to implement AI tools and applications to increase organizational productivity. Responsibilities include translating business requirements into solutions by integrating data from various SaaS sources, aligning with the data science team on AI solution architecture, and ensuring AI applications are effective and compliant. This role will be about 50% development and 50% management and support. The ideal candidate would have prior experience in both technical sales-customer support and software development experience. Strong communication and team building skills are necessary for this role.

  


**Qorvo locations:** Richardson, TX, Apopka, FL, Greensboro, NC and Hillsboro, OR

  


**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Leads the definition, deployment, operation, and optimization of AI across sales, marketing, and applications platforms.
* Contributes to the development of custom AI applications, including UI/UX, that integrate data and services from multiple sources SaaS platforms including Salesforce, SAP, Seismic, Discourse, and Databricks.
* Aligns with central data team on data architecture, pipelines, and ETL processes in support of corporate data strategies and to enable AI applications.
* Implements instrumentation and monitors AI application performance and conducts continuous improvement.
* Ensures security and compliance with relevant corporate standards and regulations.
* Coordinates with SaaS platform leads on AI tools, strategy, and roadmaps.
* Facilitates support and AI training for Sales, Marketing, and Applications users.
* Works with Sales, Apps and Marketing business owners to translate business requirements into technical specifications and AI powered solutions.

**Key Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, electrical or computer engineering or related field
* Strong software development skills including python, SQL, database architectures and cross-platform API integration
* Ability to quickly master new technologies, languages, and development environments as needed
* A keen interest in AI and the ability to lead efforts to quickly prototype and evaluate the performance of AI powered solutions
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with the ability to understand complex semiconductor sales and customers support processes and data


**Preferred:**


* Experience as a FAE, sales engineer, customer support engineer or related work
* Academic or commercial experience in developing AI applications, particularly in the context of sales, CRM or technical customer support applications
* Semiconductor or electronics industry experience
* Electrical engineering or hardware design experience in RF, power or IoT
* Software application development experience with front-end frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js)
* Experience developing Software as a Service (SaaS) hosted applications
* Salesforce certifications - Platform App Builder, Platform Developer, or Architect

  


MAKE A DIFFERENCE AT QORVO

  


We are Qorvo. We do more than create innovative RF and Power solutions for the mobile, defense and infrastructure markets – we are a place to innovate and shape the future of wireless communications. It starts with our employees. As a unified global team, we bring a commitment to excellence, growth and a passion for creating what's next. Explore the possibilities with us.

  


We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) / Affirmative Action employer and welcome all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, military or veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, and/or any other status protected by law.


Qorvo is an E-Verify Employer. For more information, please see the Right to Work and E-Verify Participation posters.
company_description: Qorvo® does more than enable the billions of devices all around you. It's a place where employees stretch their imaginations and push boundaries.

title: Senior Manager, Data Science - Supply Chain
description:
With more than 13,000 stores in the U.S. and 84,000 stores globally, it is no wonder 7-Eleven, Inc. has been named an iconic brand. In addition to 7-Eleven stores, 7-Eleven, Inc. also operates and franchises Speedway, Stripes, Laredo Taco Company and Raise the Roost locations.

  

Since inventing the convenience industry in 1927, 7-Eleven has built a rich 96-year history filled with beloved products like Slurpee, Big Gulp and Big Bite, and fan-favorite holidays like Slurpee Day and Bring Your Own Cup Day.

  

Now, 7-Eleven is on a mission to contemporize the brand and redefine convenience – and we need your help.

* **About This Opportunity**
***JOB SUMMARY:***  

Lead a team of data scientists in the modeling and optimization of complex demand chain problems, and the
  

development of KPI visibility tools for the entire Supply Chain department. The team will develop network analytics, optimization, simulation, machine learning models and niche data science techniques to evaluate product flow from vendor to distribution center and customer. The models will focus on improving fill rate, lead time, cost and inventory efficiency, while ensuring sufficient capacity for throughput and storage. The team will also build dashboards, reports, maps, etc. to assess the health of the Supply Chain, identify improvement opportunities and implement appropriate solutions.

  



***KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:***  

* Manage a portfolio of data science projects, models and analyses. Assign data scientists to each initiative,

ensuring high resource utilization and adherence to scope, timeline and budget.
  

* Design and lead the development of comprehensive visibility tools (dashboards, reports, etc.) for all major

Demand Chain KPIs.
  

* Identify improvement opportunities and work collaboratively with other teams to implement appropriate

solutions.
  

* Act as subject matter expert for different data science techniques, such as Linear programming, mixed integer programming, clustering, Monte Carlo simulation, discrete event simulation, regression, random forest, SVM’s, other machine learning techniques and advanced statistical skills.
* Ensure high data quality and accuracy for the entire team's output.
* Hire, train, coach, develop and retain an effective team of data scientists.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
  

EDUCATION: Masters
  

YEARS OF RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE: 7+ years
  

YEARS OF MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCE: 2+ years
  

CERTIFICATIONS / LICENSES: NA
  

  

SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
   

Expert in Microsoft Office tools
   

Experience in programming with SQL, R, and/or Python
   

Working knowledge implementing optimization and simulation models.
   

Experience in Network Modeling
   

Knowledge of advanced statistics.

  

#LI-KA1
company_description: 7-Eleven, Inc. is the premier name in the convenience-retailing industry. Based in Irving, Texas, 7-Eleven operates, franchises and/or licenses more than 13,000 stores in the U.S. and Canada.

title: Data Scientist Intern
description:
Qlarant is a not-for-profit corporation that partners with public and private sectors to create high quality, safe, and efficient delivery of health care and human services programs. We have multiple lines of business including population health, utilization review, managed care organization quality review, and quality assurance for programs serving individuals with developmental disabilities. Qlarant is also a national leader in fighting fraud, waste and abuse for large organizations across the country. In addition, our Foundation provides grant opportunities to those with programs for under-served communities.

  



Are you a rising senior, grad student or recent grad looking to further your knowledge of Data Science and gain valuable work experience? Qlarant is offering an eight-week summer internship for a high achieving candidate with a grade point average of at least a 3.0.

  



The internship is based in our Easton, Maryland headquarters. A well-qualified candidate could be home-based in Maryland. The selected candidate should plan to work 40 hours per week with a start date of June 5, 2023. The start date is preferred but there is flexibility if a different date is needed.

  



The intern will work with our Data Science team engaged in the development of cutting edge products for the public and private sectors. The internship may include but is not limited to:


+ Develop an understanding of the data relevant to the problem to be addressed.
+ Utilize data wrangling techniques to work with data with the assistance of Data Scientists when needed.
+ Assist the Data Science team in establishing deterministic and probabilistic linkages between structured and unstructured data sources. Develop ways to extract and summarize the sought information in the data using basic statistical, data mining and machine learning techniques.
+ Use basic machine learning and data mining techniques to understand the patterns in large volumes of data, identify relationships, correlate disparate datasets, detect data anomalies, and classify data sets.
+ Assist the Data Science team to design and build algorithms and predictive models using techniques such as linear and logistic regression, support vector machines, ensemble models (random forest and/or gradient boosted trees), neural networks, and clustering techniques.
+ Convert designs and specifications into computer code as assigned. Compiles code into programs and corrects errors. Analyzes code to find causes of errors and revises programs.
+ Prepare and present a final project.
+ Establishing deterministic and probabilistic linkages between structured and unstructured data sources. Develop ways to extract and summarize the sought information in the data using basic statistical, data mining and machine learning techniques.
+ Automate standardized processes optimization.

  


  

  

Required Skills  

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:


* Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
* Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions.
* Judgment - Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions.
* Design - Generates creative solutions; Translates concepts and information into images; Uses feedback to modify designs; Applies design principles; Demonstrates attention to detail.
* Other Skills and Abilities:  

	+ Familiarity with statistical programming and database software and MS Office.
	+ Ability to perform basic assembly, manipulation, and analysis of data including some or all of the following: data extraction, cleaning, visualization, presentation, etc.
	+ Ability to work with highly sensitive information while preserving the confidentiality of the information.
	+ Ability to deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

  

  

  

Required Experience  

* Current rising senior, grad student or recent grad in a quantitative field such as applied mathematics, statistics, biostatistics, physics, computer science, or operations research required.
* Academic courses, projects, internships and/or work experience that includes some or all of the following: data extraction and cleaning, exploratory analysis, predictive modeling, machine learning, monitoring of algorithms, coding and data visualization.
* Experience with programming languages such as Python, R, SAS, Matlab, SQL, Pig, Hive, and Scala strongly preferred.
* Intermediate level Microsoft Office skills to include Excel, PowerPoint and Word.

  



Qlarant is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.

title: Senior Design Technologist, Generative AI Innovation Center
description:
* Bachelor's degree, or 10+ years of technical specialist, design and architecture experience
* 7+ years of software development with object oriented language experience
* Experience in cloud based solution (AWS or equivalent), system, network and operating system
* 7+ years of continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) experience
* Experience designing and prototyping with tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, Axure, Keynote, and InVision.


The Generative AI Innovation Center (GAIIC) is the AWS Professional Services program to provide customers with science and strategy expertise and unlock business value of generative AI and machine learning.
  
  

As a senior Design Technologist, you will work as a technical leader alongside customer business, development and infrastructure teams. You will facilitate technical and design discussions with IT executives to help enterprises speed their adoption of new technologies and practices, build solutions or prototypes for large customer-facing features, work efficiently and routinely to deliver the right things with limited guidance.
  
  

The role requires the ability to focus on ambiguous problem areas in known or new customer experiences. Proactively identify opportunities and/or problems with product User Experience (UX). For larger prototyping and product integration efforts, you are able to split development work into parallel tasks that can be performed by you and others and then reassembled into a successful prototype launch. Understand the business and technology impact of the experiences you create for customers. You show good judgment and influence trade-offs between desired short-term feature and longer-term product implications of various UX proposals. Stay on top of UX design and technology trends, understanding when to use them and how to adapt them to your product use cases and the scale of the project. You are a key influencer in product strategy. Drive mindful discussions with customers, product managers, other designers, engineers, and stakeholders. You bring perspective and provide context for current technology choices and guide future technology choices. Understand that not all problems are new (or require new software). You make appropriate architectural trade-offs. Your code submissions and approach to work are exemplary – your solutions are inventive, secure, easily maintainable, appropriately scalable, and extensible. You will drive the adoption (and when appropriate, creation) of prototyping tools, frameworks, and platforms. You set standards and drive adherence to quality and design best practices for your team. You work to resolve the root cause of endemic problems including areas where your team limits the innovation of other teams (bottlenecks). This may require you to influence UX and technical design decisions made by other teams. When confronted with discordant views, you are able to find the best way forward and influence others to follow that path (build consensus). You actively recruit and help others leverage your expertise by coaching and mentoring in your organization (or at your location). You contribute to the professional development of colleagues, improving their UX skills, technical knowledge,and engineering practices. Your team is stronger because of your presence, but does not require your presence to be successful.
  
  

Sales, Marketing and Global Services (SMGS)
  
  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

About the team
  
About AWS
  
  

Diverse Experiences
  
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS?
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship & Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
  
  

Atlanta, GA, USA | Austin, TX, USA | CA, USA | Dallas, TX, USA | Herndon, VA, USA | Nashville, TN, USA | New York, NY, USA | Seattle, WA, USA | Washington, DC, USA
  
  

* Master's degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
* Demonstrated success as a software developer, application architect, product manager, CTO, or consultant working with various platforms
* Architecting, designing and developing applications on the AWS platform.
* Designing and building application using Container and serverless technologies.
* Exposure to Agile software development and DevOps practices such as Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Continuous Integration and automated deployment.


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
  
  

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
  
  

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
  
  

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $122,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $239,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

description:
