title: Ph.D Data Scientist, R&D (Decision Sciences Identity Team)
description:
Job Description  
  
In this role, you will contribute to research initiatives and develop enhancements to Epsilon’s CORE Personalization Platform to continually increase the capabilities of Epsilon’s digital marketing businesses.

We prioritize analytical thinking, creativity and computer science skills over ad tech industry experience. If using internet-scale data to drive business impact excites you, and you enjoy the kind of research that starts with a blank sheet of paper that turns ideas into a new technological reality, we want to talk to you.

**Responsibilities**

* Individually contribute to data science and machine learning R&D projects
* Use your data science, machine learning, and/or computer science skills to conduct research and contribute to solutions to technology and business problems
* Contribute to projects from early-stage research through development
* Implement and optimize state-of-the-art algorithms in distributed environments
* Develop an understanding of Epsilon PeopleCloud Digital Media Solutions personalization platform and proprietary datasets
* Participate fully in our collaborative approach to research and applications projects

**Qualifications**

* Ph.D. in a computational, mathematical, engineering, or scientific field
* Fluency in computer programming, data structures, and algorithm design
* Proven analytic and modeling skills
* Proven ability to conduct research projects
* Research experience in a computational area such as data science, computer science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistics, or graph algorithms
* Verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to summarize technically complex information for a non-technical audience
* Organizational, motivational, and interpersonal skills

**Additional, But Not Required Skills**

* Spark libraries
* Scala programming
* Python programming
* SQL queries
* Experience with distributed computing
* Experience with Hadoop and cloud databases
* Demonstrated proficiency working with business and technical teams to integrate algorithms into product platforms on large data sets

Additional Information  
  
**About Epsilon**

Epsilon is a global advertising and marketing technology company positioned at the center of Publicis Groupe. Epsilon accelerates clients’ ability to harness the power of their first-party data to activate campaigns across channels and devices, with an unparalleled ability to prove outcomes. The company’s industry-leading technology connects advertisers with consumers to drive performance while respecting and protecting consumer privacy. Epsilon’s people-based identity graph allows brands, agencies and publishers to reach real people, not cookies or devices, across the open web. For more information, visit epsilon.com.

**When you’re one of us, you get to run with the best.** For decades, we’ve been helping marketers from the world’s top brands personalize experiences for millions of people with our cutting-edge technology, solutions and services. Epsilon’s best-in-class identity gives brands a clear, privacy-safe view of their customers, which they can use across our suite of digital media, messaging and loyalty solutions. We process 400+ billion consumer actions each day and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with more than 8,000 employees around the world. Check out a few of these resources to learn more about what makes Epsilon so EPIC:

* **Our Culture**: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/our-culture-epsilon
* **Life at Epsilon**: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/epic-blog
* **DE&I**: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/diversity-equity-inclusion
* **CSR**: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility

**Great People Deserve Great Benefits**

We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.

**Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer.** Epsilon’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories. Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Company Description  
  
Publicis Media Exchange (PMX) is the global media platform for Publicis Groupe [Euronext Paris FR0000130577, CAC 40]. PMX is an omnichannel activation powerhouse that drives smart application of investment through leveraging scale, marketplace innovation, deeper partnerships and knowledge. PMX is at the forefront of the converging marketplace building data-informed, tech-enabled media to help marketers connect with consumers in a measurable way.

Job Description  
  
NXT is looking for a talented data scientist for an exciting opportunity on the DSF team at Publicis Media in New York City. You would be involved with helping design and scale a new workflow for Shelf Intelligent Media using retail data and analytics. Candidates will be considered based on their ability to design large distributed technical solutions, contribute to research endeavors resulting in real world projects and data pipelines that support data products.

This is a hybrid role, requiring three days in-office each week. If you are contacted for an interview, your recruiter will discuss specifics with you, inclusive of any necessary reasonable accommodations.

* Design and contribute to data science pipeline using python and Snowflake
* Write Python/Pyspark applications for data processing and modeling

* Research and Develop custom solutions related to digital shelf data
* Manage and administer analytics workflow and reporting
* Investigate, procure, and incorporate new technologies to enhance capabilities
* Run client team interviews/de-briefs, collect disparate information to inform proposals and SOWs
* Collaborate Cross-Functionally: effectively manage cross-functional initiatives and relationships across agencies, partners, delivery teams, regions, and clients

Qualifications  
  
* Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science/Engineering, Statistics, or related field
* 2-3 years' data engineering or data science experience (preferably in Python, and/or PySpark/Scala)
* Must have a strong programming background
* Must be able to demonstrate understanding of Web Services and Cloud Computing
* Knowledge of Big Data Systems (BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS Athena / S3)
* Proficient in designing efficient and robust analytics/reporting workflows
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to work in teams and collaborate with others to clarify requirements
* Must enjoy being challenged and solve complex problems on a daily basis
* Experience in financial or econometric modeling (extra credit)

Located in Chicago, our unique employee-centric company culture is one that our team finds inviting, comfortable and fun. Please visit www.ninjatrader.com to learn more about our business.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Data Scientist**  
  
**The Organization:**  
We help society’s foundational institutions—healthcare and higher education—to achieve their full potential in service to others.  
  
We are our clients’ trusted partners in ever-changing times. For more than 30 years, Kaufman Hall has provided independent, objective insights grounded in sound data and analysis to help clients fulfill their missions, achieve their goals, and tackle their toughest problems.  
  
Kaufman Hall provides world-class management consulting in strategic financial planning (a concept we created); performance improvement; partnerships, mergers, and acquisitions; and treasury and capital markets. Kaufman Hall’s consulting is supported by a deep foundation of data assets and data-driven tools.  
  
At Kaufman Hall, we believe that sustained success is never an accident. It is the result of sound decision making, based on data-driven analysis and disciplined thinking, and guided by the fundamental principles of corporate finance.  
  
**The Position:**We are currently looking for a data scientist to support our data efforts for both internal consulting practices and external clients. The role will be focused on the development and application of data science techniques to solve our nation’s most challenging healthcare problems. This role will have the opportunity to help shape and guide our consultants and client’s decision making through data-driven approaches. This role will collaborate closely with our subject matter experts and data science team, and will support the enhancement of consulting deliverables, conduct direct client consulting, create meaningful thought leadership pieces, and support our overall analytics infrastructure. Functions of this role will include exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, creation and deployment of machine learning models, development of client-facing presentations and models, and everything in-between. We seek a well-rounded data scientist who is excited to apply advanced techniques to the healthcare environment to improve financial and operational outcomes in an ethical way, and thereby support the health of all our communities, while working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.  
**Primary Responsibilities:*** Develops creative data-driven solutions by employing data science techniques such as operations research, advanced statistics, feature engineering, machine learning/AI, predictive analytics, mathematical modeling, linear and non-linear regression, stochastic modeling, and mathematical optimization
* Communicates the benefits and limitations of various approaches to stakeholders and crafts data narratives that are both cogent and impactful
* Creates complex models and algorithms drawing from diverse, large and complex datasets
* Builds or deploys data science models that effectively translate client and consultant requirements into actionable output
* Builds and deploys optimization models to combine disparate analyses and perform sensitivity analyses such that the primary objectives are best met
* Participates in both client-facing and internal meetings to explain approaches and deliverables through effective data storytelling
* Participates in research to continually advance analytical, operations research, and process improvement methodologies for solving complex problems
* Collaborates with application development teams in the development of scalable tools
* Appropriately documents work for posterity, debugging, and future enhancement

**Qualifications:*** 3+ years of progressive data science experience required. Healthcare finance/operations experience is a plus. Prior consulting experience preferred.
* Experience in developing, utilizing, and deploying bespoke data science methodologies such as machine learning/AI, linear programming, severity and risk modeling, optimization modeling, operations research, or logistics science within business settings
* Proficiency in Python. Experience with PySpark, business intelligence tools, data querying tools (e.g. SQL), or statistical software (e.g. R, SAS) preferred.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and other common business software.
* Ability to assess client/project needs, outline project goals, define project deliverables, and establish timelines
* Experience working on concurrent projects and managing multiple internal and external stakeholders at various levels
* Strong oral, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
* Possess basic understanding of accounting practices. Experience with healthcare operations and reporting practices preferred.
* Self-directed learner who demonstrates intellectual curiosity, operates independently, and works efficiently in an inter-disciplinary team environment
* An entrepreneurial spirit that is inquisitive, proactive, interested in learning new tools and techniques
* Unquestionable commitment to personal and corporate integrity in every situation
* Applicants for employment must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Kaufman Hall (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

**Education Requirements:*** Master’s degree in data science, operations research, statistics, or a relevant technical field (Predictive Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.), or equivalent practical experience

**Physical Requirements:*** Must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily with reasonable accommodations.
* Work is generally done sitting, talking, hearing and typing. Visual acuity to use a keyboard, prepare and analyze data and figures; transcribing, viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.

**Work Environment:*** Travel Required: Minimal, 0-10%
* The role is remotely based or based in Chicago.
* Work is regularly performed in a combination of office and home office settings and routinely uses standard office equipment.
* It may require the maintenance of a home office and proximity to an airport for work related travel.

Kaufman Hall is committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. We recruit, hire, train, promote, pay, and administer all employment actions without regard to actual and also perceived or assumed protected group status as defined by law of an individual or that individual’s associates or relatives. Our policies and the law prohibit employment discrimination against any employee or applicant on the basis of any legally protected status.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Scalesology is a growing consulting company that helps businesses scale their data processes and technology, working with clients wherever they are on their analytics journey. We are looking for passionate, innovative, and mindful individuals to build our Data and Analytics team. This is a full-time remote position.  
  
At Scalesology, we pride ourselves on providing a positive atmosphere of integrity and respect for our employees and clients. Our Core Values are a daily part of everything we do. * Commit to the Cause: We are committed to being responsive, passionate, intentional, and diligent in everything we do.
* Treat others like you want to be treated: We treat our clients and our colleagues with mindfulness, humility, respect, and integrity.
* Focus on the Leading Edge: We embrace continuous learning in order to implement innovative technologies for our clients. We are not satisfied with the status quo.
* Celebrate the Journey: We believe in working hard, recognizing our employees’ efforts along the way, and having fun as we do it.

If you have a strong analytical background, appreciate working on a diversity of projects, and enjoy solving challenging data issues across different industries - this is the job for you!  
  
**Responsibilities*** Work with clients to understand their complex data and analytic business problems, gather requirements, and generate proposed solutions to meet their needs.
* Provide statistics, machine learning, and business intelligence expertise on projects based on large-scale data.
* Assist in data lake, data warehouse and database design and implementation for analytical solutions.
* Conduct data mining and exploratory data analysis.
* Develop, optimize, validate, and deploy statistical and machine learning algorithms (e.g. GLM, Naïve Bayes, time series, random forests, neural networks, clustering, NLP, GAN, LLM).
* Create effective data visualizations that generate actionable insights for business improvements.
* Act as a mentor to clients, providing best practices and educating them on their analytical solution.

**Requirements*** 4+ years of experience developing and deploying advanced statistical and machine learning models
* 4+ years of experience in SQL and one of the following: Python, Julia, R, or similar language
* Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
* Proficiency developing and deploying models in a Cloud environment such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
* Database and API integration experience
* Extensive data wrangling experience in data ingestion, cleansing, transformation, validation, and enrichment.
* Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
* Experience with Agile methodology, JIRA, and Github
* Team player with excellent verbal and written communication
* B.S. (or graduate degree preferred) in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
* Must live in Illinois, Indiana, or Wisconsin or be willing to move.

 

---

title: Data Scientist - Decision Science
description:
**Company:** Oak Street Health 

**Title:** Associate, Data Scientist 

**Location:** Chicago, IL / Remote 

 

**Company Description** 

Oak Street Health is a rapidly growing company of primary care centers for adults on Medicare in medically-underserved communities where there is little to no quality healthcare. Oak Streetâ€™s care is based on an entirely new model that is based on value for its patients, not on volume of services. The company is accountable for its patients' health, spending more than twice as long with its patients and taking on the risks and costs of their care. For more information, visit http://www.oakstreethealth.com. 

 

**Role Description** 

Oak Street Health is looking for an associate data scientist to join our care and risk modeling team. This team is responsible for delivering high quality modern data solutions through collaboration with engineers, analysts, and product teams in a fast-paced, agile environment leveraging cutting-edge technology to reimagine how healthcare is provided. In this position, you will be responsible for taking on new initiatives associated with enhancements, expansion, maintenance and scaling in data science. As a member of our team, you will make an immediate impact as you help expand our data science capabilities across our whole care model. This is a fast-paced role with high growth, visibility, impact, and where many of the decisions for new projects will be driven by you from inception through production. 

 

**Core Responsibilities:** 

* 
Utilize advanced mathematical and statistical methods to solve business problems under the supervision of senior data scientists 

* 
Execute exploratory data analysis to validate and quantify trends identified by partner organizations. 

* 
Develop insights, visualizations, and other data artifacts that support broader data science initiatives 

* 
Wrangle and analyze large structured and unstructured datasets in a highly repeatable fashion 

* 
Demonstrate strong communication skills (both written and verbal) and a positive, solution-oriented attitude 

* 
Other duties as assigned 


 

**What we're looking for:** 

* 
Bachelor's degree and 1 year of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field 

* 
Proficiency in SQL and Python 

* 
Clear and concise through all mediums of communication 

* 
Demonstrated ability to decompose multi-tier problems into actionable steps 

* 
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills 

* 
Innate curiosity to get at the how and why of a problem 

* 
US work authorization 

* 
Someone who embodies being Oaky 


 

**What does being Oaky look like?** 

* 
Radiating positive energy 

* 
Assuming good intentions 

* 
Creating an unmatched patient experience 

* 
Driving clinical excellence 

* 
Taking ownership and delivering results 

* 
Being scrappy 


 

**Why Oak Street?** 

  
Oak Street Health offers our coworkers the opportunity to be at the forefront of a revolution in healthcare, as well as: 

* 
Collaborative and energetic culture 

* 
Fast-paced and innovative environment 

* 
Competitive benefits including paid vacation and sick time, generous 401K match with immediate vesting, and health benefits 


Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply to oakstreethealth.com/careers.

title: Senior ML / Generative AI Developer
description:
Senior ML / Generative AI Developer  

  

Remote  

  

Our client is a global leader in Telecommunications, wireless and IoT solutions. This role is part of their advanced research and product development teams and is working on the cutting edge of AI-driven automation. With this group you will be designing and building customized and complex LLM’s to support of variety of IoT, product network and client support use cases across multiple verticals. Innovation drives this practice group and they are on the leading edge of Generative AI and Deep Learning.  

  

Duration: 12 Months+ **Required Skills & Experience**
* The ideal candidate should have at least 5 years of professional experience as a Machine Learning Developer and at least 1-2 years of expertise in implementing Gen AI technologies to derive meaningful insights from large datasets.
* Strong proficiency in Python and relevant frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas, Numpy, and scikit-learn.
* Proficiency in machine learning, deep learning, and data mining techniques.
* Strong of experience in Generative AI/LLMs and should be adept at delivering and productionizing.
* At least 3 years of experience in software engineering, building REST APIs/GraphQL and/or interfaces using frameworks like FastAPI, Flask, or Django.
* The candidate should demonstrate skills and experience with the latest LLM tools and techniques such as LangChain, Promptflow, vector DB, prompt engineering, etc.
* Should possess strong expertise in GenAI pipelines, various language models (LLM) like GPT-4, BERT, or LLAMA, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems.
* Should stay updated with the latest advancements in generative AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), and prompt engineering and bring innovative ideas to the team.


  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, product managers, and business analysts to understand their requirements and implement effective GenAI solutions.
* Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate prompts into applications, identify technical challenges, and implement innovative solutions.
* Write efficient, reusable, and modular Python code for the implementation of GenAI algorithms and models.
* Deploy LLM projects to production and define success-measuring criteria/KPIs.
* Lead the design and development of artificial intelligence solutions, specifically leveraging Python for GenAI applications.
* Implement testing strategies to ensure the reliability and accuracy of GenAI models, troubleshoot issues, and optimize performance.
* Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for GenAI solutions, including design specifications, coding standards, and deployment.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Job Purpose:
About TrainAI by RWS  

Training or fine-tuning artificial intelligence (AI) requires data. LOTS of data. However, not just any data will do – our clients need responsible AI data that’s targeted, accurate and reliable to ensure machine learning (ML) success. But preparing AI training data is a monumental task that can take up the vast majority of AI project time, leaving AI teams with precious little time to focus on developing, deploying and evaluating ML models. TrainAI by RWS helps our clients address this challenge head-on.  

With a seamless blend of technological understanding and human intelligence, TrainAI provides complete, end-to-end data collection and content generation, data annotation or labelling, human-in-the-loop data validation and generative AI data services for all types of AI, in any language, at any scale, based on the principles of responsible AI. Today, TrainAI supports four of the world’s top five technology companies, enhancing the performance of their generative AI applications by providing services such as prompt engineering, response refinement and red teaming with locale-specific domain experts across a broad range of topic areas and educational levels. **Are you ready to be part of a growing, cutting-edge team and advance your career?****Come grow with us!**
Job Overview:  

As a Marketing Manager on the TrainAI team, you will work closely with TrainAI’s Senior Marketing Manager, Sales, Group Marketing and external vendors to ensure the successful development and implementation of marketing strategies for TrainAI.

Responsibilities  


Strategic marketing: Develop and execute marketing strategies to drive TrainAI growth and achieve business objectives  

* 

Service marketing: Build awareness and demand for TrainAI data services across industries and markets  
* 

Campaign management: Develop and implement multi-channel integrated marketing campaigns (leveraging email, social media, print / digital advertising, PR and more) to support TrainAI’s lead generation pipeline  
* 

Sales support: Based on a thorough understanding of TrainAI’s buyer personas, develop marketing collateral and sales enablement materials (such as brochures, sell sheets, case studies, blogs, presentations, web content, videos and more) to address their needs  
* 

Event management: Manage TrainAI’s participation at industry trade shows and conferences, whether attending, exhibiting or speaking, to maximize event ROI  
* 

Cross-collaboration: Work with other members of the TrainAI team as well as Group Marketing and other sales and marketing teams across RWS to achieve business objectives  
* 

Partner management: Manage relationships with external ad agencies and other vendor partners as needed  
* 
* Measurement and reporting: Monitor, refine and report on marketing performance, optimizing strategies as needed based on marketing KPIs and key stakeholder feedback

  

Education and experience  


4-year degree in marketing, communications, advertising or related field, plus 10 years of marketing experience required  

* 

B2B marketing experience working in technology or a technical industry preferred  
* 

Demonstrable experience using AI tools for marketing  
* 
* Must be prepared to share relevant insights and examples of prior work

  

Skills and competencies  


Motivated, results-oriented self-starter with strong interpersonal and communications skills  

* 

Passionate about AI and its potential, and a willingness to continually learn  
* 

Ability to work independently and multitask in a fast-paced environment  
* 

Excellent command of the English language with strong writing / editing skills  
* 

Well-organized with a keen attention to detail  
* 

Versatile with the ability to objectively create and revise work without regard for personal preferences  
* 

Ability to effectively communicate with global stakeholders  
* 

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word and PowerPoint, and beginner to intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel  
* 
* Experience using Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Hubspot, Salesforce and AI tools a definite plus

 **Base Pay**


$85,000 - $100,000 / year + Bonus

 *Actual rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to: position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. Total compensation may also include variable incentives, bonuses, benefits, and/or other perks, as outlined in any formal offer made.*

* Candidates must reside in State advertised to be considered


California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Massachusetts, Minnesota, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Oklahoma Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Washington, Wisconsin


Life at RWS:

At RWS, we’re here for one purpose: unlocking global understanding.

  

As a unique, world-leading provider of technology-enabled language, content, and intellectual property services, we remove the barriers to communication to make global connection possible. Our unrivalled experience and deep understanding of language have been developed over more than 60 years. As we look to shape the future, our ambition is to create a world where understanding is universal for everyone.

  

We work with over 80% of the world’s top 100 brands, more than three-quarters of Fortune’s 20 ‘Most Admired Companies’ and almost all the top pharmaceutical companies, investment banks, law firms and patent filers. Our client base spans Europe, Asia Pacific and North and South America. Our 65+ global locations across five continents service clients in the automotive, chemical, financial, legal, medical, pharmaceutical, technology and telecommunications sectors.

  

If you like the idea of working with smart people who are passionate about breaking down language barriers and giving back to their communities, then you’ll love life at RWS. Our work fundamentally recognizes the value of every language and culture. So, we celebrate difference, we are inclusive and believe that diversity makes us strong.

  

We want every employee to grow as an individual and excel in their career. In return, we expect all our people to live by the values that unite us: to partner with colleagues and clients, to adopt a pioneering spirit, to be positive in progressing the work we do, and always to deliver what we promise.

 **RWS Values**  

Get the 3Ps right – Partner, Pioneer, Progress – and we´ll Deliver together as **One RWS**.  

For further information, please visit: **RWS**  

**RWS embraces DEI** and promotes equal opportunity, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind. RWS is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at RWS are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion, nationality, ethnicity, sex, age, disability, or sexual orientation. RWS will not tolerate discrimination based on any of these characteristics. **Covid Vaccination** - All RWS employees hired for positions that require working on-site at RWS offices, customer offices, travel on behalf of RWS, and/or in-person meetings will be required to comply with the RWS USA COVID-19 Vaccination and Testing Policy. RWS complies with federal, state, and local laws regarding accommodations related to this policy. **Recruitment Agencies:** RWS Holdings PLC does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward any unsolicited resumes to any RWS employees. Any unsolicited resume received will be treated as the property of RWS and Terms & Conditions associated with the use of such resume will be considered null and void. **RWS is an Affirmative Action Employer**. For more information about EEO/AAP legislation please visit: https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

title: LLM Application Developer
description:
OUR WHY

So people worldwide can embrace an understanding of the Father-Heart of God and, through covenant relationship, reconnect to their true identity of who they were made to be in Christ Jesus, Yeshua the Messiah.

The Role

LionSentry at Curt Landry Ministries is on a mission to develop an AI journaling app that empowers spiritual growth, and we're looking for an LLM Application Developer to join our journey. This role is at the heart of creating transformative user experiences by leveraging generative AI to reflect, discover, and align life's purpose. Ideal candidates are passionate about AI, prompt engineering, and have a knack for developing innovative solutions.

We seek someone with Python expertise, experience in LangChain or Llama Index, and a familiarity with the generative AI community. This role demands creativity, problem-solving skills, and a collaborative spirit.

Offering a $115,500 salary, remote work flexibility, a chance to amplify your work in the generative AI space, and the opportunity to impact lives meaningfully. Join us to push the boundaries of AI journaling and make a real difference.

Responsibilities:

* Develop and implement algorithms for verifying the quality of dynamically generated content in real-time.
* Design systems for sourcing and visibility into Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), including source similarity assessments.
* Improve our smart chunking algorithm to optimize RAG application data handling and improve LLM efficiency.
* Develop automatic prompt optimization strategies to maximize effectiveness within given runtime or cycle constraints.
* Implement Chain of Thought (CoT), Tree of Thought (ToT), and other logic chaining techniques in ways that are easy for other developers to work with.
* Design and develop an active Chain of Thought (CoT) toolkit for dynamic prompt adjustment.
* Work to improve our LLM debugging framework focused on content quality improvement.
* Help to grow and manage the open-source community around this project.

Required Skills:

* An obsession with generative AI and the future of content generation.
* An interest in building out the future of AI from a prompt engineering lens.
* Strong, battle-tested communication skills.
* A willingness to build things that no developer has built before.
* Experience implementing LangChain and/or Llama Index in at least one production application.
* Familiarity with translating prompt engineering techniques into code.
* At least two years of on-the-job Python development experience.
* At least one year of experience contributing to open-source projects.

The Right-Fit

We are looking for a team player who…

● Loves Jesus—Is continually growing in their relationship with Jesus and has a passion for caring for and helping people grow closer to Him.

● Builder + Leader—Is energized by an opportunity to shape and build a thriving creative ministry.

● Team Player—Thrives in a collaborative environment and has a ‘we,’ not ‘me’ ministry mindset and approach.

● Flexible—Is able to work hard and effortlessly embrace change in a fast-paced culture.

● Organized—Is gifted at providing systems, structure, and administration to help power the media ministry in a healthy and sustainable way.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $115,500.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Compensation package:

* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 1 year

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Work Location: Remote

title: Clinical Informaticist
description:
**Clinical Informaticist**  

**Remote Opportunity**

  

  

**JOB SUMMARY:**


Skilled nurse informaticist to work with machine learning, NLP, generative AI modeling, research and development. The ideal candidate will engage with AI engineers, data scientists, and clinical product teams to provide clinical data expertise to develop and refine innovative analytic solutions and data models to support VBC entities. Applies expert-level clinical knowledge to enhance data-driven analytics, interactions, and interventions for all utilizers of point of service solutions. Recommends, interprets, and communicates inputs to, processes used, and results from AI and other analytic models to ensure that they follow sound methodologies, are fed by unbiased data, and result in clinically coherent results; including, but not limited, to developing, reviewing and validating data reports, and presenting findings in a clear and concise manner to help improve reporting and documentation. Interacts with customers, partners, and clinical practitioners to ensure enterprise solutions are rooted in principles of sound clinical practice, consider appropriate risk factors, and are monitored to minimize risks of bias or drift in the data and recommendations.


This role will report to the Vice President of Clinical Prospsective MDP


**WHAT YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE:**


* Collaborates with Machine Learning/Natural Language Processing (ML/NLP) engineers and clinical teams to provide expert insights into real-world clinical decisions, coding, and interpretation of cases and findings.
* Guides the development and refinement of NLP algorithms by leveraging expertise in medical nomenclatures and coding systems.
* Ensures the accuracy and relevance of clinical data used in generative AI models from constructing the samples, ensuring sufficient "edge cases", curating inputs such that sound methodologies were followed.
* Participates in the design and implementation of studies to validate and improve the performance of NLP applications in clinical settings.
* Contributes to the selection and development of tools and processes that enhance the usability of clinical data in research and healthcare applications.
* Serves as a bridge between the technical team and clinical practitioners, translating clinical needs and data into actionable insights for technical development.
* Liaison between customer healthcare providers and other stakeholders to gather requirements and feedback for AI-driven informatics projects.
* Participates in the development of training materials and documentation for end-users of AI applications in healthcare.
* Conducts regular reviews of AI model performance, ensuring accuracy and compliance with clinical standards and socioeconomic factors to foster interventions to reduce obstacles in obtaining needed health care.
* Collaborates with data governance teams to ensure the integrity, security, and quality of healthcare data used in AI applications.


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:**

  

* Current Registered Nurse Licensure
* Experience with and preferably certification in medical records clinical coding practices.
* 8+ years' work experience
* Clinical Informatics Applications (CPOE, Evidence Based Order Sets, Provider Documentation)
* EHR Documentation Optimization
* Evidence Based Clinical Documentation, Promoting Interoperability and the Clinical Information Integrity Program (CIIP).


**OTHER SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE:**


* Deep understanding of real-world uses of standard medical nomenclatures (for example, ICD, CPT/HCPC, LOINC, NDC, SNOMED) and aspects of the Unified Medical Language System (UMLS).
* Experience with healthcare data standards such as HL7, FHIR, and ICD-10.
* Expert-level understanding of medical and clinical data.
* Experience with electronic health records in clinical settings.
* Familiarity with healthcare system workflows and clinical practices.
* Proficiency in statistical analysis and data manipulation techniques.
* Some knowledge of machine learning algorithms and their applications in healthcare.
* Ability to develop and refine data models for healthcare analytics.
* Working competence in using statistical software and tools for data analysis.
* Experience using data visualization and interpretation of complex data sets.
* Excellent communication skills to interact with customers, partners, and clinical practitioners.
* Capacity to translate complex data insights into actionable healthcare interventions.
* Problem-solving abilities to address challenges in data-driven analytics.
* Leadership and teamwork skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.


**SALARY RANGE:** $90,000 - $110,000 / annually


Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. Pay is based on several factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.


Reveleer E-Verifies all new hires.


Reveleer is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Legal Operations Associate
description:
***This is a remote-first role that can be based in Canada.***  
Legal Ops Associates help ensure that the demand letters (legal documents with accompanying exhibits that illustrate an injured party's economic and non-economic damages resulting from a personal injury incident) we deliver to our clients are accurate, effective, and high quality. Our Associates are on the front lines of our mission to ensure that personal injury victims receive the compensation they're entitled to. This is a perfect role for someone who enjoys persuasive writing, working in a fast-paced environment, and getting into the details of their work as you work alongside an established team of high-performers.  
**What you'll do:**

* Work with our proprietary software online portal to review medical documentation, write concise and detailed treatment summaries, organize damages, establish treatment timelines, and conduct legal research to draft compelling demand letters
* Work against a weekly quota and be rewarded with a bonus for high-quality production above the quota

**What we look for:**

* Strong persuasive writing skills and attention to detail
* Ability to organize, multi-task, prioritize, and collaborate with reviewers and various teams across the company
* Demonstrated ability to learn quickly with the ability to swiftly pick up new processes and software
* Knowledge of personal injury law, medical summaries, or copywriting/editing experience is a plus

*Base compensation for this role is $50,000-$60,000 in local currency. Team members are eligible for performance-based bonuses with a target of an additional 10% of their base salary annually.*

**Benefits & Perks:**  
Our goal is to empower every team member to contribute to our mission of fostering a more just world, regardless of their role, location, or level of experience. To that end, we offer:

* Choice of medical, dental, and vision insurance plans for you and your family
* Flexible paid time off and 10+ holidays per year
* A stipend to upgrade your home office for fully-remote roles

*EvenUp is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and inclusion in our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

**About EvenUp:**  
EvenUp is a venture-backed generative AI startup that ensures injury victims are awarded the full value of their claims, expanding the $100B+ in awards granted to injury victims each year. Every year, the legal system has made it difficult for millions of ordinary people to seek justice, especially for folks without means or who come from underrepresented backgrounds. Our vision is to help these injury victims get the justice they deserve, irrespective of their income, demographics, or the quality of their legal representation.  
EvenUp operates across a variety of personal injury cases, including motor vehicle accidents and negligence claims. Our ML-driven software empowers attorneys to accurately assess the value of these cases by doing a core part of their workflow (legal drafting), enabling them to secure larger settlements in record time. As EvenUp evaluates more cases, our proprietary data grows, enhancing the precision of our predictions and delivering more value to both attorneys and victims alike.  
We are one of the fastest growing startups ($0 to $10M in ARR in <2 years) and are funded by some of the best investors in the world, including Signalfire, Bain, and Bessemer, who led our recent $50M Series B.  
Compensation Range: $50K - $60K

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

title: Generative AI Architect
description:
HCLTech is looking for a **Generative AI Architect** (GenAI) with ability to help in building deep learning and Generative AI capabilities.

Job Title: Generative AI Architect

Position Type: Full-time

Location: Remote

The ideal candidate should have 8-10 years of experience in developing Data Science, AI, and ML solutions, with a specific focus on generative AI and LLMs in the Finance/Telecomm/LSH/Manufacturing/Retail domain.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Prior experience in identifying new opportunities to optimize the business through analytics, AI/ML and use case prioritization.
* The individual should be a thought leader having a well-balanced analytical business acumen, domain, and technical expertise.
* Large Language Model Expertise: Experience in working with and fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs), including the design, optimization of NLP systems, frameworks, and tools.
* Application Development with LLMs: Experience in building scalable applications using LLMs, utilizing frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, etc and productionizing machine learning and AI models.
* Language Model Development: Utilize off-the-shelf LLM services, such as Azure OpenAI, to integrate LLM capabilities into applications.
* Cloud Computing Expertise: Proven architect kind of experience in cloud computing, particularly with Azure Cloud Services.
* Technical Proficiency: Strong skills in UNIX/Linux environments and command-line tools.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Experience:

* Programming and ML Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a deep understanding of machine learning algorithms, deep learning, and generative models.
* Advanced AI Skills and Testing: Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), hands-on experience in deploying AI/ML solutions as a service/REST API on Cloud or Kubernetes, and proficiency in testing of developed AI components.
* Responsibilities also include data analysis/preprocessing for training and fine-tuning language models. Also, solves virtually all issues around privacy, real-time, sparce data collection, passive data collection and security and regulatory requirements.

How You’ll Grow

At HCLTech, we offer continuous opportunities for you to find your spark and grow with us. We want you to be happy and satisfied with your role and to really learn what type of work sparks your brilliance the best. Throughout your time with us, we offer transparent communication with senior-level employees, learning and career development programs at every level, and opportunities to experiment in different roles or even pivot industries. We believe that you should be in control of your career with unlimited opportunities to find the role that fits you best.

Equality & Opportunity for All

Representing 165 nationalities across the globe, we pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.

*Desired Qualifications*

title: Senior Manager, Generative AI Product Engineering - People Leader - (Remote Eligible)
description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
Senior Manager, Generative AI Product Engineering - People Leader - (Remote Eligible)
Our mission at Capital One is to create trustworthy, reliable and human-in-the-loop AI systems, changing banking for good. For years, Capital One has been leading the industry in using machine learning to create real-time, intelligent, automated customer experiences. From informing customers about unusual charges to answering their questions in real time, our applications of AI & ML are bringing humanity and simplicity to banking. Because of our investments in public cloud infrastructure and machine learning platforms, we are now uniquely positioned to harness the power of AI. We are committed to building world-class applied science and engineering teams and continue our industry leading capabilities with breakthrough product experiences and scalable, high-performance AI infrastructure. At Capital One, you will help bring the transformative power of emerging AI capabilities, to reimagine how we serve our customers and businesses who have come to love the products and services we build.


We are looking for an experienced Sr. Manager to help build and maintain APIs and SDKs to train, fine-tune and access AI models at scale. You will work as part of our Enterprise AI team and build systems that will enable our users to work with Large-Language Models (LLMs) and Foundation Models (FMs), using our public cloud infrastructure. You will work with a team of world-class AI engineers and researchers to design and implement key API products and services of our capabilities and enable real-time customer-facing applications powered by these capabilities. Examples of projects you will work on include:

* Architect, build and deploy well-managed core APIs and SDKs to access LLMs and our proprietary FMs including training, fine-tuning and prompting tasks, including orchestration SDKs.
* Design APIs for performance, real-time applications, scale, ease of use and governance automation.
* Develop application-specific interfaces that leverage LLMs and FMs to continue to enhance the associate and customer experience..
* Enable our users to build new AI capabilities
* Develop tools and processes to monitor API access patterns and operational health.
* Design and implement AI safety and guardrails in the API layer working closely with researchers.


Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a technical field.
* At least 8 years of experience programming with Python, Go, Scala, or C/C++
* At least 5 years of experience designing and building and deploying ML applications.
* At least 2 years of experience mentoring and leading teams developing AI and Machine Learning solutions
* At least 4 years of people management experience.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Familiarity with building large-scale AI products or platforms for NLP, speech, computer vision, or recommendation systems serving millions of users.
* Ability to move fast in an environment with ambiguity at times, and with competing priorities and deadlines. Experience at tech and product-driven companies/startups preferred.
* Ability to iterate rapidly with researchers and engineers to improve a product experience while building the foundational capabilities
* Familiarity with deploying large neural network models in demanding production environments.
* Have experience with API security, observability, cloud access control and privacy best practices.


Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

title: Senior Lead Engineer - Generative AI Infrastructure (Remote-Eligible)
description:
NYC 299 Park Avenue (22957), United States of America, New York, New York
Senior Lead Engineer - Generative AI Infrastructure (Remote-Eligible)
Our mission at Capital One is to create trustworthy, reliable and human-in-the-loop AI systems, changing banking for good. For years, Capital One has been leading the industry in using machine learning to create real-time, intelligent, automated customer experiences. From informing customers about unusual charges to answering their questions in real time, our applications of AI & ML are bringing humanity and simplicity to banking. Because of our investments in public cloud infrastructure and machine learning platforms, we are now uniquely positioned to harness the power of AI. We are committed to building world-class applied science and engineering teams and continue our industry leading capabilities with breakthrough product experiences and scalable, high-performance AI infrastructure. At Capital One, you will help bring the transformative power of emerging AI capabilities to reimagine how we serve our customers and businesses who have come to love the products and services we build.


We are looking for an experienced Sr. Lead Engineer, Generative AI Infrastructure to help us build the foundations of our AI capabilities. You will work on a wide range of initiatives, whether that’s building large-scale distributed training clusters, or deploying LLMs on GPU instances for real-time applications and decisioning systems, or supporting cutting-edge AI research and development, all in our public cloud infrastructure. You will work closely with our cloud and container infrastructure teams as well as our world-class team of AI researchers to design and implement key capabilities. Examples of projects you will work on:

* Deploy a thousand-node training cluster optimizing storage and networking stack, with tightly coupled training pipelines to take advantage of multiple parallelism strategies, in our public cloud.
* Design and build fault-tolerant infrastructure to support long-running large-scale training tasks reliably despite failure of individual nodes, using containers and check-pointing libraries.
* Design and build run-time infrastructure for serving large ML models such as LLMs and FMs in our public cloud.
* Build infrastructure for deploying search indexes and embeddings in vector databases that will work closely with the rest of our capabilities.


Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity

  

Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a technical field
* At least 8 years of experience designing and building data-intensive solutions using distributed computing
* At least 8 years of experience programming with Python, Go, Scala, or Java
* At least 1 year of experience with HPCs, vector embedding, or semantic search technologies
* At least 1 year of experience building, scaling, and optimizing training or inferencing systems for deep neural networks


Preferred Qualifications:

* Master's or Doctoral degree in Computer science, Computer Engineering, Electrical engineering, Mathematics, or a similar field.
* Background in machine learning with experience in large scale training and deployment of deep neural nets and/or transformer architectures.
* Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or Pytorch, Lightning, Mosaic ML etc.
* Ability to move fast in an environment with ambiguity at times, and with competing priorities and deadlines.
* Experience at tech and product-driven companies/startups preferred.
* Ability to iterate rapidly with researchers and engineers to improve a product experience while building the foundational capabilities.
* Familiarity with deploying large neural network models in demanding production environments.
* Experience with building GPU clusters in the public cloud with tightly-coupled storage and networking.


Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Capital One is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.

San Francisco, California (Hybrid On-Site): $248,700 - $283,800 for Sr. Lead Machine Learning Engineer
Remote (Regardless of Location): $198,900 - $227,000 for Sr. Lead Machine Learning Engineer

title: Senior Director - AI Prior Authorizaiton - ClearPath
description:
As the Senior Director of ClearPath, you will play a pivotal role in revolutionizing healthcare by developing MRIoA’s cutting-edge Prior Authorization technology solution powered by generative AI. Your leadership will guide the creation, execution, and delivery of a comprehensive project plan, marshaling both internal and external resources to meet ambitious milestones. This role is at the forefront of blending technology and healthcare, aiming to significantly improve patient and provider experiences.

 **Position Summary:**


Senior Director ClearPath is responsible for building MRIoA’s automated Prior Authorization process and technology solution leveraging generative AI. This includes generating and driving the project plan and program scope, directing internal and external resources, vendor management, deliverable and timeline management, and metrics to ensure the on-time delivery of the program.

**Roles:**

* Build the product specification with the selected partners and ensure deliverables are completed on time and according to our specifications.
* Own the Multigenerational Program Plan (MGPP) and build a 5-year development program to continue to enhance the product
* Collaborate with IT, clinical, operations, finance and sales to build a solution that exceeds the expectations of the market.
* Work with marketing and sales to develop a strategic Go-To-Market strategy that includes customer targeting, building sales material and campaigns for clients, prospects, and members to deliver the desired financial returns
* To provide leadership and direction of the internal communication strategy for ClearPath. Be the voice of MRIoA’s ClearPath AI strategy to external constituents
* To support staff activities related to the ClearPath business and fulfillment processes
* To serve as a liaison between the departments as it relates to ClearPath
* Create the benchmarks to ensure high quality standards for Clearpath are met

  

Requirements:
  

* Bachelor's degree preferably in business, IT or health care
* PMP Certification highly preferred
* 10 years project/program management experience leading projects and provide evidence of completed programs
* Minimum of five years in health insurance, health care and/ or managed care arenas Knowledge of Auto PA process and experience within this space
* AI Experience: past experience implementing AI and a willingness to learn and adapt to the quickly changing AI landscape
* Data Management: Hands-on experience with unstructured data, including collecting, processing, and using it effectively in AI models or systems (preferred) Experience working with clinical teams
* Experience building a regulated product
* Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Experience working alongside clinical teams (nurses, physicians, pharmacists) to understand their needs and integrate their insights into technology solutions. Demonstrable skills in translating clinical requirements into technical specifications.

*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

*This company is a drug-free workplace. All candidates are required to pass a Background Screen before beginning employment. All newly hired employees will take a Drug Screen, as well as agreeing to all necessary Compliance Regulations on their first day of employment.*

We are looking for an experienced Senior Distinguished Engineer, AI Systems, to help us build the foundations of our enterprise AI Capabilities. You will work on a wide range of initiatives, whether that’s designing robust, secure infrastructure, building large-scale distributed training clusters, deploying LLMs on GPU instances for real-time use cases, or supporting cutting-edge AI research and development, all in our public cloud infrastructure. You will work with a team of AI engineers and researchers to envision the target state of our capabilities while helping to design and implement key services. Examples of projects you will work on include:

* Design and build fault-tolerant infrastructure to support long-running large-scale training tasks reliably despite failure of individual nodes, using containers and check-pointing libraries.
* Design and build infrastructure for serving large ML models, in our public cloud.
* Deploy a thousand-node training cluster optimizing storage and networking stack, with tightly coupled training pipelines to take advantage of multiple parallelism strategies, in our public cloud.
* Design and implement benchmarks to measure the performance of software systems within AI capabilities and make recommendations on technology selection
* Develop applications that leverage LLMs and FMs.
* Design and implement capabilities to support MLOps for foundation models.


Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity


Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a technical field
* At least 9 years of experience designing and building distributed computing HPC and large-scale ML systems
* At least 6 years of experience developing AI and ML algorithms in Python or C/C++
* At least 3 years of experience with the full ML development lifecycle using AI and ML frameworks and public cloud.


Preferred Qualifications:

* Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience with a focus on modern AI techniques.
* Experience designing large-scale distributed platforms and/or systems in cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
* Experience architecting cloud systems for security, availability, performance, scalability, and cost.
* Experience with delivering very large models through the MLOps life cycle from exploration to serving.
* Experience with building GPU clusters in the public cloud with tightly-coupled storage and networking.
* Experience with the complete stack for distributed training of large models including ML compilers, distributed training frameworks, and ML development frameworks such as Pytorch, Tensorflow, Lightning etc.
* Experience with one or multiple areas of AI technology stack including prompt engineering, guardrails, vector databases/knowledge bases, LLM hosting and fine-tuning.
* Authored research publications in top peer-reviewed conferences, or industry-recognized contributions in the space of neural networks, distributed training and SysML.

  

Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

San Francisco, California (Hybrid On-Site): $340,500 - $388,700 for Sr Distinguished Machine Learning Engineer

title: Generative AI Engineer
description:
As a Generative AI Engineer, you’ll play a crucial role in advancing our music generation models using cutting-edge techniques and architectures.
### **Description**


At Boomy Corporation, we’re building the future of music: human-driven, AI-powered music creation experiences with instant monetization. Backed by some of the biggest names in music and growing fast, we’re seeking an experienced Generative AI Engineer to join our team.  

As a Generative AI Engineer, you’ll play a crucial role in advancing our music generation models using cutting-edge techniques and architectures. Your knowledge and experience will help us support a new generation of music-makers, with a commitment to ethical use of training data and respect for human artistry at the center of all we do.  

Your responsibilities will include:  

* Designing, implementing, and maintaining training pipelines for generative AI music models
* Developing and experimenting with novel music generation systems
* Aligning training systems and infrastructure to optimize model performance and efficiency
* Preprocessing and curating large-scale datasets for training and attribution
* Training, fine-tuning, and evaluating generative AI music models
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including customer success, A&R, software engineers, and music domain experts
* Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in generative AI and music technology

  

Requirements for this position include:  

* Strong background in machine learning, generative AI, and real-world AI applications
* Experience with large-scale distributed training on GPUs or TPUs
* Experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
* Familiarity with generative AI music models like MusicGen, Stable Audio, Jukebox, or similar
* Proficiency in Python and other programming languages commonly used in AI/ML
* Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
* Strong communication and collaboration abilities
* Passion for pushing the boundaries of AI-generated music

  

Bonus points for:  

* Advanced degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience)
* Understanding of digital signal processing and music theory
* Knowledge of audio codecs, formats, and music production tools
* Contributions to open-source AI/ML projects or research publications
* Familiarity with music genre classification, music information retrieval, or music recommendation systems

  

We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and the opportunity to work on groundbreaking AI technology in a collaborative and innovative environment. If you are passionate about the intersection of AI and music and want to shape the future of generative music, we encourage you to apply.  


#### **Salary**


$90,000 - $150,000 per year

title: Distinguished Engineer, Generative AI Systems (Remote-Eligible)
description:
Locations: NY - New York, United States of America, New York, New York
Distinguished Engineer, Generative AI Systems (Remote-Eligible)
Distinguished Engineer, Generative AI Systems


Our mission at Capital One is to create trustworthy, reliable and human-in-the-loop AI systems, changing banking for good. For years, Capital One has been leading the industry in using machine learning to create real-time, intelligent, automated customer experiences. From informing customers about unusual charges to answering their questions in real time, our applications of AI & ML are bringing humanity and simplicity to banking. Because of our investments in public cloud infrastructure and machine learning platforms, we are now uniquely positioned to harness the power of AI. We are committed to building world-class applied science and engineering teams and continue our industry leading capabilities with breakthrough product experiences and scalable, high-performance AI infrastructure. At Capital One, you will help bring the transformative power of emerging AI capabilities to reimagine how we serve our customers and businesses who have come to love the products and services we build.


We are looking for an experienced Senior Distinguished Engineer, AI Systems, to help us build the foundations of our enterprise AI Capabilities. You will work on a wide range of initiatives, whether that’s designing robust, secure infrastructure, building large-scale distributed training clusters, deploying LLMs on GPU instances for real-time use cases, or supporting cutting-edge AI research and development, all in our public cloud infrastructure. You will work with a team of AI engineers and researchers to envision the target state of our capabilities while helping to design and implement key services. Examples of projects you will work on include:

* Design and build fault-tolerant infrastructure to support long-running large-scale training tasks reliably despite failure of individual nodes, using containers and check-pointing libraries.
* Design and build infrastructure for serving large ML models, in our public cloud.
* Deploy a thousand-node training cluster optimizing storage and networking stack, with tightly coupled training pipelines to take advantage of multiple parallelism strategies, in our public cloud.
* Design and implement benchmarks to measure the performance of software systems within AI capabilities and make recommendations on technology selection
* Develop applications that leverage LLMs and FMs.
* Design and implement capabilities to support MLOps for foundation models.


Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity


Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a technical field
* At least 7 years of experience designing and building distributed computing HPC and large-scale ML systems
* At least 5 years of experience developing AI and ML algorithms in Python or C/C++
* At least 3 years of experience with the full ML development lifecycle using AI and ML frameworks and public cloud.


Preferred Qualifications:

* Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience with a focus on modern AI techniques.
* Experience designing large-scale distributed platforms and/or systems in cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.

* Experience with one or multiple areas of AI technology stack including prompt engineering, guardrails, vector databases/knowledge bases, LLM hosting and fine-tuning.
* Authored research publications in top peer-reviewed conferences, or industry-recognized contributions in the space of neural networks, distributed training and SysML.

title: VP of Partnerships, Cloud & Generative AI
description:
**Website:** https://www.invisible.co/


**Blog:**https://inv.tech/blog


**Overview/Sales Deck:**https://docsend.com/salesdeck


**Recorded Demo:** https://www.youtube.com/demo


**Partner Pay Transparency:** **https://inv.docsend.com/view/d58q6nvdwm7ifcfp**


**Core Values:**https://www.notion.so/invisibletech/Invisible-Values

  

### **Who we are**



Invisible has experienced exponential growth, quadrupling in size year over year for the past three years. By the conclusion of 2023, we are on track to achieve an annual recurring revenue (ARR) of $100 million. Operating as a profitable business, we maintain a near complete ownership stake, with a firm foundation built on robust financial management. As part of our commitment to our team, we are excited to offer substantial equity compensation, presenting a life changing equity opportunities for our Partners


**Invisible Technologies** stands at the forefront of operations innovation. We remove strategic roadblocks for clients, providing solutions to the world's most complex business problems.A technology-led managed execution service, our success is driven by our powerful process orchestration platform, which blends the perfect mix of artificial and human intelligence with automation to create extraordinary growth and scale opportunities for clients

  


### **We believe that...**


* **Our Mission** is to unlock the creative potential of people and companies; we are the engine that powers innovation.
* **Our Clients** are pioneers of innovation; in industries ranging from AI to insurance to solar, many of our clients are well-known and on the cutting edge of technology and strategy.
* **Ownership** is our guiding value; every partner on the team is the "CEO" of their area - each of us are empowered to jump in and solve the problems in front of us.
* **Meritocracy** creates alignment; the value someone produces should be reflected back in the position of responsibility and compensation that they receive.
* **Transparency** is vital for us to run an entirely remote organization; what one of us knows, all of us should know.

  


### **Your Mission**



As a VP of Partnerships, Cloud & Generative AI at Invisible, you will play a critical role in managing & expanding partnerships with the world's leading cloud and generative AI organizations. Your goal will be to establish joint GTM motions with our largest partner to achieve topline revenue targets while also driving AI adoption through their clients with Invisible's Operations Innovation capabilities.



This is a role for someone interested in building a partnerships function as a strategic IC first in an organization operating on the cutting edge of commercializing Generative AI. As such, this role will require a blend of strategic and tactical thinking; you'll be challenged to apply best practices of partnership management while also synthesizing market feedback cross-functionally to build Invisible's solutions. Critical to your success will be the ability to prioritize your efforts to build scalable motions that enable achieving aggressive revenue targets.



This role will require interfacing heavily with business and technical partner stakeholders, ensuring compliance with partner pipeline management guidelines, building co-sell motions, ensuring Invisible's presence at key events, and hitting revenue goals.


### **Responsibilities**


* Develop and execute a comprehensive partnerships strategy to drive growth and revenue through strategic alliances and collaborations through develop joint value propositions, go-to-market strategies, and co-selling opportunities.
* Engage Partner's Field Sales organization, channels, and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for Invisible
* Identify key focus areas, target markets, and partnership opportunities aligned with the company's objectives and market trends.
* Work closely with internal teams, including product development, sales, marketing, and legal, to drive partnership initiatives and ensure successful execution.
* Cultivate strong relationships with key partners, serving as the primary point of contact
* and advocate for their interests within the company.
* Collaborate closely with partners to

  


### **Experience**


* 7+ years of experience in business development, strategic partnerships, partner management, or similar roles at a high-growth startup
* Experience working with hyperscalers, particularly AWS
* Results-oriented with a focus on driving measurable impact and delivering value to partners and customers through the achievement of revenue goals
* Ability to successfully operate autonomously in a highly matrixed organization, working cross-functionally, leading priorities and exercising influence
* Working in highly technical environments, particularly in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning or Tech Infrastructure
* Strong written and verbal communication, and experience presenting to senior executives
* Entrepreneurial spirit with a willingness to take calculated risks and explore new business opportunities.

  


**Compensation & Benefits**


* Working Times: US (EST or PST) Hours
* Compensation Breakdown
+ Base: $175,000
+ Base + Target Earnings $350,000
+ Generous Equity

* Flexible Work Schedule / Unlimited Vacation Days
* Work Remotely

* Design and build fault-tolerant infrastructure to support long-running large-scale training tasks reliably despite failure of individual nodes, using containers and check-pointing libraries.
* Design and build infrastructure for serving large ML models, in our public cloud.
* Deploy a thousand-node training cluster optimizing storage and networking stack, with tightly coupled training pipelines to take advantage of multiple parallelism strategies, in our public cloud.
* Design and implement benchmarks to measure the performance of software systems within AI capabilities and make recommendations on technology selection
* Develop applications that leverage LLMs and FMs.
* Design and implement capabilities to support MLOps for foundation models.

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a technical field
* At least 9 years of experience designing and building distributed computing HPC and large-scale ML systems
* At least 6 years of experience developing AI and ML algorithms in Python or C/C++
* At least 3 years of experience with the full ML development lifecycle using AI and ML frameworks and public cloud.


Preferred Qualifications:

* Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience with a focus on modern AI techniques.

* Experience with delivering very large models through the MLOps life cycle from exploration to serving.
* Experience with building GPU clusters in the public cloud with tightly-coupled storage and networking.
* Experience with the complete stack for distributed training of large models including ML compilers, distributed training frameworks, and ML development frameworks such as Pytorch, Tensorflow, Lightning etc.
* Experience with one or multiple areas of AI technology stack including prompt engineering, guardrails, vector databases/knowledge bases, LLM hosting and fine-tuning.

title: AI Training for Ukrainian Writers
description:
**FOR UKRAINIAN WRITING EXPERTS ONLY**


**Are you interested in helping to train AI models to become better writers?**


**How it works:**


* We have several open projects where we are looking for talented writers to help train generative artificial intelligence models to become better writers.
* You can work on all of our projects remotely. Hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you.
* Your earnings from ongoing projects are sent out weekly.


**You Will:**


* Work on various writing in Ukrainian projects to train generative AI models.
* Some examples of projects you might work on:
+ Rank a series of responses that were produced by an AI model.
+ Based on a given topic, write a short story about that topic.
+ Assess whether a piece of text produced by an AI model is factually accurate or not.

**Preferred Qualifications:**



These are not must-have qualifications! You should apply if you meet **any** of these (or anything similar you think makes you a good fit).


* Professional Translator
* Enrollment or completion of an undergraduate program in a humanities field or field related to writing
* Enrollment or completion in a graduate program related to creative writing
* Experience writing professionally (copywriter, journalist, technical writer, editor, etc.)


**Earnings & Duration:**


* Earnings:
	+ $19 - 24 USD / hr
* Location: Remote (Globally)
	+ Preferably USA, Germany, Poland, and the Czech Republic
* Duration: Variable depending on project length, flexible hours

  



This opportunity involves contracting for Smart Ecosystem, Inc.

Additionally you will manage end-to-end coordination with operations and manage creation of high quality curated datasets and productionizing of models along with working with applied research and product teams to identify and prioritize ongoing and upcoming services.

* Design and implement capabilities to support MLOps for foundation models.

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a technical field

* At least 3 years of experience implementing full lifecycle ML automation using MLOps(scalable development to deployment of complex data science workflows)

* Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to work independently with ownership, and as a part of a team with a strong sense of responsibilities.
